bioghist.p: The USS Philadelphia (C-4), also known as "Cruiser No. 4", was a cruiser of the United States Navy. She was laid down 22 March 1888 by William Cramp and Sons, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, launched 7 September 1889, sponsored by Miss Minnie Wanamaker, daughter of merchant and philanthropist John Wanamaker; and commissioned 28 July 1890, Capt. B. F. Bradford in command.

scopecontent.p: A memoranda book on construction of the USS Philadelphia, including dimensions and weights, lists of compartments, list of ship's complement (crew), armaments, machinery, stowage, coal capacity, and so on. Includes several printed pages from the Navy Department's Bureau of Equipment on the care and preservation of iron and steel ships. The cover of the volume is inscribed "E. Rodgers, USN, USS Philadelphia."

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
